description: From Latin polītus (“polished”), past participle of poliō (“I polish, smooth”); see polish.

adjectives.description: polite (comparative politer or more polite, superlative politest or most polite)

examples: He marries, bows at court, and grows polite.
rays of light  […] falling on  […] a polite surface

verbs.description: polite (third-person singular simple present polites, present participle politing, simple past and past participle polited)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To polish; to refine; to render polite.
